item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father refuse thy name, thou art thyself thou not a montegue, what is montegue? tis nor hand nor foot nor any other part belonging to a man What is in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet, So Romeo would were he not Romeo called retain such dear perfection to which he owes without that title, Romeo, Doth thy name! And for that name which is no part of thee, take all thyself." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by J.S. Bach
Chadpennington10 add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I leave my peace with you. I give my peace to you. I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be troubled. And do not be afraid. John 14:27" -- Anonymous

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description:
"THE FIRST TEN LIES THEY TELL YOU IN HIGH SCHOOL
1. We are here to help you. 2. You will have time to get to your class before the bell rings. 3. The dress code will be enforced. 4. No smoking is allowed on school grounds. 5. Our football team will win the championship this year. 6. We expect more of you here. 7. Guidance counselors are always available to listen. 8. Your schedule was created with you in mind. 9. Your locker combination is private. 10. These will be the years you look back on fondly.
TEN MORE LIES THEY TELL YOU IN HIGH SCHOOL
1. You will use algebra in your adult lives. 2. Driving to school is a privilege that can be taken away. 3. Students must stay on campus during lunch. 4. The new text books will arrive any day now. 5. Colleges care more about you than your SAT scores. 6. We are enforcing the dress code. 7. We will figure out how to turn off the heat soon. 8. Our bus drivers are highly trained professionals. 9. There is nothing wrong with summer school. 10. We want to hear what you have to say." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "It's easier to floss with barbed wire than admit you like someone in middle school." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "I picked up one of the books and flipped through it. Don't get me wrong, I like reading. But some books should come with warning labels: Caution: contains characters and plots guaranteed to induce sleepiness. Do not attempt to operate heavy machinery after ingesting more than one chapter. Has been known to cause blindness, seizures and a terminal loathing of literature. Should only be taken under the supervision of a highly trained English teacher. Preferably one who grades on the curve." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "CONJUGATE THIS: I cut class, you cut class, he, she, it cuts class. We cut class, they cut class. We all cut class. I cannot say this in Spanish because I did not go to Spanish today. <i>Gracias a dios. Hasta luego.</i>" -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "Gym should be illegal. It's humiliating." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "Write about the emotions you fear the most." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "This is where you can find your soul if you dare. Where you can touch that part of you that you've never dared look at before. Do not come here and ask me to show you how to draw a face. Ask me to help you find the wind." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "If I ever form a clan, we'll be the anti-cheerleaders and walk under the bleacher forming mild acts of mayhem." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "It's easier not to say anything. Shut your trap, button your lip, can it. All that crap you hear on TV about communication and expressing feelings is a lie. Nobody really wants to hear what you have to say." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Chadpennington10 add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "Everybody told me to be a man. Nobody told me how." -- Laurie Halse Anderson
